Reviews.Title: “Tornado Detour”
Reviews.Author: Jagz_Fan
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Dallas for two nights awaiting a flight due to damages/delays caused by the slew of tornadoes that occured recently. Our first night was spent at a high-end hotel that was overpriced and designed to rip-off the business traveler. Fortunately, for the second night, I located this very nice, comfortable and affordable refuge. I was rewarded immediately upon arrival with an early check-in (before noon !!), so we could freshen up as we had no luggage. The hotel provides an excellent shuttle service so we were able to entertain ourselves with a day shopping, dining and attending a movie at a local mall, with all of the "necessary stores" that follow along with Neiman-Marcus. The property itself is dated, almost to the point of when you see a cathode ray tube television you think "antique", other than that our accomodations were very nice. WiFi was free, no continental breakfast, however a Starbucks is right around the corner. Our dinner meal was very good with large portions, our server was overwhelmed with other chores; however, he was attentive enough to accomodate us. Hopefully, flat-screen televisions will eventually make their way into the upcoming budget for this very nice property with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating... BADLY”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer N
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through another site at a huge discounted rate, which was great however the staff was not very friendly once we got here and the rooms need major renovation or updating. The interior size is nice. There's a seperate living room space, small sink/kitchen area, and decent sized bathroom. The televisions are very old and fuzzy, the decorating is very 80's in style with the hunter greens and pink accents. Room was very clean though. The area seems nice. Sandwhich shops and pharmacy's are within walking distance, and this isn't far from the Galleria Mall. Overall, we would stay here again at a deeply discounted rate, otherwise no way. The rate they are offering at the front desk I would NEVER pay to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: IcebergSlim06
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been in our "Top 3" for the last few years. The staff has always been friendly and the rooms are just what a traveler needs. One of the reasons we like this hotel (besides the bed), is the microwave and frig included in the room. The only negative are the televisions. Come on Crowne Plaza, let's upgrade those tv's!!! Other than that, we will continue to be loyal patrons of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Escape reality for just a while!”
Reviews.Author: northerndynasty
Reviews.Content: It was rather ironic how we came in to enjoying this stay, as our original plans had us booked at a "sister" hotel very close-by. Their "mistake", our "fortune", was that we had just a few extra moments to spare, which we took full advantage of by popping in to the nearby CP Park Central to just check-it-out. We had already unpacked and been settled-in at the nearby "sister" hotel which, I might add, had fabulous reviews through TA and other sites, so we were quite content with the original reservation. That is, until we entered the lobby of the CP. Whoa! Just take a look up and take in the atrium that constitutes the main lobby area. It was amazing to gaze "up to the sky" and take in the interesting architectural concept of the walk-way spoke-like view to the central elevator banks of each floor. Add in a nicely appointed, large bar, an open, airy Cafe with plenty of seating, and a small convenience store, this hotel was looking really good! We approached the front desk to just "inquire" about this beautiful hotel, and whoa - the front desk Rep either has a twin brother, or that bright, smiling gentleman who checked us in at the "sister" hotel is blazingly fast and "moonlights" at this hotel as well. Actually, Ken works at BOTH - remember, they are "sister" hotels! It was an amazing check-in that took place at the other hotel, and to be honored with his welcome at this hotel was truly a double-shot of WIN! We asked about this hotel, and all its' features, and he immediately popped us 2 keys to checkout: 1) the indoor-outdoor pool and spa 2) a room on the 10th (and top) floor. Naturally, we took advantage! The indoor-outdoor pool is a unique concept that we've only ever seen at one other hotel locally in Texas. It was a nice feature. The only issue is that whatever blows in to the pool from the outside, also meanders in to the inside, so at times can appear cluttered. The hot-tub is a nice option, and for those looking to start up the bubbles, you'll find the button located in-ground beside the tub (not on the usual wall-locales). The room: Whoa! again! We were told to head to 1027 to see what it's like to stay here. What an incredible view! Nice amenities, to include: 2 tvs, pull-out sofa-sleeper, sitting table by the window, computer/work table, bar with microwave and fridge, two large double-beds, 2 phones, dresser, incredible view to the west, and nicely appointed bathroom. The ceiling in the bathroom above the tub was in need of a cleansing, as this is where the AC/heat unit appears to be. A door separates the sleeping area from the living room area. All-in-all, a nice size, relatively clean room that definitely suited this family of 3. Alas, we were already booked in to the "sister" hotel, and would unfortunately have to hand the two keys back to our wonderful Ken...left to imagine what it would be like to stay here. After some quick friendly chit-chat with Ken, and some quick clicks of the keys on his keyboard, we found ourselves dragging our luggage and belongings from the "sister" hotel to - yep - the Crowne Plaza! As ICH members, and Ken's genuine interests in making us the happiest travelors ever - he immediately transferred our reservation here!!! Oh what a truly awesome way to start our 3-day vacation!! Our rate included the fabulous breakfast buffet each morning, which featured: a delicious array of hot foods - bacon, sausage, pancakes, fried potatoes, biscuits, gravy and hot syrup. Ask the chef behind the counter, and he'll whip-up an egg concoction to your liking at your request. Throw in the usual fruit bowl, yogurt bowl, bagels, bread, butter, cream cheese, peanut butter, green and red salsas, pastries, milk...etc. Remember to ask your waiter/waitress for juice selections as well. Oh, and did I mention, because of our rate, breakfast was included!!!!! Normally, breakfast like this will run about $15pp. But, it's all worth it whether you're paying for it or not. And the staff are very attentive and caring. Oh my goodness Yum is not doing this breakfast enough justice! From what I hear, they do lunch and dinner as well... The area is relatively safe, and very convenient to 635, Coit Rd, 75, and all points around (including about a 5 minute drive to the Galleria). There are tons of restaurants nearby, from the chains to the independents. Consider this review a 4.5 stars EASY - and if you go here and have the opportunity to meet Ken (and even Scott! :) ), you will truly understand what it's like to be taken care of and treated with absolute, genuine professionalism, care, courtesy and respect! Way to go CP! We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - with a deal”
Reviews.Author: jifner
Reviews.Content: Though I probably wouldn't pay full price for this hotel, we got a really good deal through hotwire. The hotel is well maintained though it is still a bit dated in terms of room decor. The bed was nice and I love the fact that all rooms are suites so there's plenty of space. There's a microwave and refrigerator which was really convenient. Yes, the t.v.s were dated, but I usually don't go to hotels just to watch t.v. It was more of a convenience. The staff was nice and we didn't have any problems during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Super service, clean, and a great atmosphere:)”
Reviews.Author: lovetheshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 10 floors. It has 3 central elevators which makes it nice not having to wait. The lobby area is beautiful. It has a nice sitting area with lots of comfortable seating and tables. A pretty fountain when you walk in. The resteraunt is to the right when you walk in. We only ate breakfast there. The food was good, but when they say breakfast ends at 10 do not expect there to be food at 10 even if you have paid for the included breakfast. You can still eat what is out there, but they do not refill anything it seems after 9:30. They had no eggs, biscuits, or bacon left around 9:45. The rooms are suites. We had a King suite. It was clean and had what we needed, but I was surprised at how outdated the fridge and microwave were. The decorations were cheap and older looking, but like I said they were clean an everything worked fine. The indoor heated pool wasn't very heated while we were there. It connects to the outdoor pool and it rained 2 of the 3 days so the rain may have cooled it down. The outdoor hot tub was super!! There was plenty of tables and seating outside also. The fitness room was pretty good. It is open 24 hours. There are 3 treadmills, a few stationary bikes, an elliptical, and some hand weights. They do have a tv and water inside the room. The best part to this hotel is the staff. The first moment we arrives they were extremely friendly and helpful. All 3 days we had the same experience. I would stay again just due to the good service. It's around 13 miles from Hard Rock Cafe. It is fairly close to the Gallaria mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Close to Galleria Mall”
Reviews.Author: billinankeny
Reviews.Content: The lobby and hotel are beautiful. Staff was very helpful and rooms are spacious. Great for families!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great for families”
Reviews.Author: gogogadgetmom
Reviews.Content: Love the atrium, beautiful pool. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice common area, but...”
Reviews.Author: mcs_guy
Reviews.Content: The common areas are pretty nice, but the rooms are well NOT. There was mold in the bathroom showers, rust on metal fixtures and the microwave, fridge and TVs were well dated. The pool area was OK for a motel six....so stay in the atrium and you'll be pleased. Also when we had our room serviced, they never replenished our towels and such...we had to call down to the front desk and nearly 45 minutes later we got some.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and uncomfortable!”
Reviews.Author: TravelorBecky
Reviews.Content: The reservation call center host named Julius was condescending and rude from the start despite my cheerfulness and kind replies. It seems he looks down on guests who book thru a third party. The rooms are outdated, the furniture is worn out, the wall paper is damaged, the beds are hard, the appliances are old and noisy. This hotel is not 3.5 stars. I've stayed at motels with nicer, newer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “business trip”
Reviews.Author: 48desoto
Reviews.Content: clean and comfortable, exellect staff, typical Crowne Plaza. recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Quick Trip!”
Reviews.Author: paddyflanagan
Reviews.Content: We were not at the hotel for very long...honestly no more than eight hours but the fact that there were no problems, the staff was courteous, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable and hotel quiet and safe was enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff & Great Price”
Reviews.Author: MateoVerito
Reviews.Content: I recently booked this hotel on Hotwire not knowing what I was going to get. When I arrived the room was huge and even had a separate area with a pullout bed that I didn't know it had. The open layout of the common area was very nice. It had a decent workout room and a pool next to it which was closed during my stay. It is located right next to an In & Out Burger so if you are into that all you have to do is go next door! I would highly recommend this hotel and easily stay at it again.

Reviews.Title: “2/3-2/5/2012 Stay”
Reviews.Author: penny79705
Reviews.Content: Great trip! Rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious. Hotel staff was efficient, courteous and polite. Will definitely plan another shopping trip to Dallas and stay at the Crowne Plazaâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest about available rooms.....”
Reviews.Author: mandy w
Reviews.Content: We had a non smoking room booked for over two weeks prior to arrival. We arrived this past Friday night around 10:00pm. We were told they had no non smoking rooms available and could have a smoking room. We went up to the room but the smoke smell was aweful. We proceeded downstairs to tell this to the clerk and request agan a non smoking room. He said nothing was available and was not sincere in his words. I asked for anything nonsmoking, even asking for a suite or anything. His response was "nope I don't have anything". Ok well cancel our reservation and we will take our business elsewhere. He didn't care and cancelled our room. We went next door and were able to get a room at a different hotel. Come to find out some friends who had also booked at the same time showed up 30 minutes after us that same night and were given a NON SMOKING king suite. I had just asked that man abot a non smoking room and was told no. But 30 minutes later they suddenly have a room? Absurd. Not to mention the hotel is in desperate need of updating and remodeling. The hotel has nothing to offer. The rooms are old and outdated. Will never return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but dated decor”
Reviews.Author: shamekila
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza this past weekend and I immensely enjoyed myself. I was in the Oxford suite with a conference table, sleeper sofa, bar stools, and three other chairs. 16 persons could have enjoyed this suite with my husband and I. The decor is dated in the room; however, there is so much space a person will not focus on the decor. I would have given the property an excellent rating but there was an event held at the hotel and the elevator service was horrible. The hotel really needs a elevator attendant because I had to fight to get out of the elevator because a large group was staying and having events at the hotel. I had to walk 7 flights of stairs because of the chaos. Nevertheless, this hotel provided great service. Make sure to have $50 per night for incidentials.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean but no wow”
Reviews.Author: katmarren
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel was definately a good buy. The room was clean and roomy. The lobby was welcoming and the staff friendly and helpful. We were able to use the large outdoor hottub and had it all to ourselves. I think I only saw one other group of guests use it the 3 days we were there. I also used the business center which was adequate. Breakfast was a bit pricey especially since it was buffett style but of good quality and service. The location was easy to find and had fast food and CVS quite close. All in all I have no complaints, only that it was just OK no lasting impression or wow.

Reviews.Title: “Job well done!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed P
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller. I am a real estate appriasser. I had to give to the people that keeps this property clean and modern. Engineering Staff has to be commented for this extra ordinary work on this old building. I don't see any sales manager's in the lobby to greet guests as i see in other hotels. (morning or evening) Very helpful front desk staff- Ken, JC & Amer Resturant Staff like Daisy & Hannah take care of you as soon as you walk into the resturant. Ahmed Patel, Last stayed at this property in November 2011

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, good quality breakfast, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sascha1982
Reviews.Content: Located somewhat North of Dallas city centre, at the crossing of I635 and Fwy 75, Crowne Plaza Suites Dallas is a very decent place to stay, with spacious rooms and all the aminities even for longer stays for business or leisure. The hotel itself is not the youngest anymore, but everything is well maintained and works as it should, The reception at the hotel was professional, as expected. The hotel design is quite special, with an inside-out model, where the rooms are arranged around a big central hall with the elvators in the middle of this square. This makes it look quite impressive, but it can also get a little noisy at times. The room was very spacious, consisting of two rooms connected by a door (room at the entrance with sofa, coffee machine, tables, etc. + the second room with kingsize bed and access to the bath room). Not exactly necessary when you are staying for business, but still nice and a type of noise insulation from the interior plaza of the hotel. Everything was clean, neat, and in good working order. An iron was also in the room, yet I missed an ironing board and had to use a table + towel - which is fair enough, Breakfast was very good. Waffles, scrambled eggs all done to your liking, and the staff was always attentive and friendly. Overall, at ~$100 a night, this hotel can definitely be recommended when coming to the Dallas area, even for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: goochiemae
Reviews.Content: Lay-out of room is excellent, including a door for the bedroom so if one person wants to go to bed before others, they can. Room was big with sitting room including sofa, easy chair and ottoman, desk and table that could be rolled out. Lots of lamps for good lighting. Bathroom has large vanity for all your stuff, tub and shower. Bed was very comfortable. It was a little strange that the TV's haven't been replaced yet, but I'm sure that will happen soon. Wireless access was fast and reliable. Staff was knowledgeable and courteous. Lobby welcoming and warm despite it's enormous size. We had breakfast at the hotel cafe and it was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: This hotel has wonderful staff, decent beds, and clean rooms. I recommend it for meetings or for business traveler. They have decent food and if eating at the hotel is not for you there are several chain type places to eat one exit down on Greenville. There is a Starbucks in the shopping center in front of the hotel and a CVS right on the same corner in case you forgot anything. It is usually a decent price for what you get and it is easy to get off and on the main highway (LBJ 635) or 75.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 4 day stay”
Reviews.Author: Victoria517
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel with a big lobby area. There are many places to sit and visit downstairs which is nice. Our room was very spacious with a separate living area with a door that separated the bedroom. We ate breakfast at the buffet one morning which was about 15 a person but the sausage did not appear to be cooked thoroughly, the omelet was the only thing I liked. The hotel has a bar but everytime we tried to get a drink around 11, they were closed. The only really bad thing about the hotel were the elevators, there were 3 but they were very slow to arrive at our floor. Overall this was a nice hotel, with large clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy - good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Spicy04
Reviews.Content: I agree with everyone's comments; the rooms are dated, but roomy and clean. We arrived late at night so we could not get a double room with beds like we had wanted. The were a bunch of soccer kids/teams staying at the hotel - I guess they got all the doubles before we arrived. We had to call down for a blanket for the pull-out couch - when it arrived it was very ragged and stiff (didn't use it). Decided to use the comforter from the king bed for the pull out. We spent less than 10 hours in the hotel -so we did not eat at the restaurant or use any facilities. Although the TVs were dated - it was nice to have one in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Well Taken Care of Older Property”
Reviews.Author: KSinSBC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and will stay here again. For the location, you can't beat the price. Some of the rooms are more updated that others (so request an updated room at the front desk). The only item in my room that was seriously dated was the microwave (which was tucked away under the sink), but it worked just fine. If you need edgy/modern, this is not for you. Bedding was well above par for the price point. Wifi is really fast (but only when the hotel is not full of business travelers). And the free parking is a big plus!

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: Queserasera101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was close to family. I always like a separate living room, but this one was pretty badly dated. (Think gramma's apartment). The hotel seemed to have alot of children, but happily, it was pretty quiet. The electronics and appliances were quite old and well used. I was disappointed to find that there was no safe in the room. There is one sink in the bathroom and the make-up mirror was above the sink. My husband and I had to take turns getting ready. If they had put the mirror over the counter at the other end, it would have been so much more efficient. Also, the wi-fi was probably dial up. Not worth the effort of attempting to connect. My husband and I travel quite a bit and some things carry over from place to place....like hanging up your towels to use them again. We did this here and they were removed. The sofa bed was horrid!!!! The mattress was really unusable it was so thin (unless of course you LIKE sleeping on a steel rod). My husband just had to listen to me snore...lol. To end on a positive note, the lobby area was quite lovely. The room was clean. Check in and check out was quick and easy. (It is also conveniently located next to an In & Out Burger!! ) Don't think I would stay there again though. Dallas has too many really nice places.

Reviews.Title: “Not real impressesed but clean and roomy”
Reviews.Author: travel4workAA
Reviews.Content: Hotel is large, similar to an Embassy Suites. Rooms are large 2 room suites, but very old and need to be updated. Rooms were clean, but dust in the vents and mold in the corners of the bath room. Fridge and microwave were very old and the microwave didnt really work. The toilet needed to be replaced, make all kinds of noise every time you flushed. My rate included breakfast, which was nice, a full buffet. Room service was pricey and not very great. The best thing was the Black and Blue tacos. The work out room is old, but includes 2 treadmills and free weights. However it was always very hot and the water was always empty. Staff was friendly. The elevators were very slow and the stairs were not easy to navigate (and took you outside).

Reviews.Title: “Best Dallas Value”
Reviews.Author: Sue F
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautifully decorated with tasteful furnishings, luxurious linens, and very comfortable beds. The rooms are suites with all appliances and furnishings needed to prepare/warm and serve meals. The desk clerks and belmon were courteous, fast, and very helpful. I was extremely surprised with how nice the hotel is, by the price of the rooms. By far, the best value in Dallas that I've seen!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KeithLisaTX
Reviews.Content: We liked every thing about this hotel. The young man at the front desk went out of his way to get us directions to where we were going and recomended a good place to watch the Ranger game. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel for price, roominess and convenience.”
Reviews.Author: Denise B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times in Dallas. It appears to be an older Embassy Suite including the older televisions and microwave. This does not concern me as it is extra roomy, perfect when our son is along and we have a pull out couch in the extra living room. It is easy to get to Greenville ,downtown and the Love airport. Staff is very friendly. I would like to suggest to the hotel that they make the restaurant something for a quick bite and affordable. Like a pizza parlor with a salad bar, and family friendly. $13 is too much for a burger when you can walk to In and Out Burgers nearby, The steak is expensive and I prefer to go to a fine dining establishment in Dallas for that, Give me a casual place I can grab a bite and hang out with my friends and family, The bar is nice but not so much a place for families, Something simple with a limited menu is fine. About $5 a person around $12 for a pizza to share. This will help your cost conscience travelers and make your restaurant more busy and profitable. Other than that I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great value at an older upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Runnin26
Reviews.Content: The Staff is friendly rooms are spacious, but could be updated. Easy access, very clean. Food is just ok

Reviews.Title: “Think Embassy Suites Before a Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Brino99
Reviews.Content: If you have been to an Embassy Suites before many of them recently renovated, you will know exactly what to expect at Crowne Plaza Suites Dallas - Park Central. I say that because I like to stay at Embassy Suites and the ones I stay at in Dallas have recently updated their furniture and TV's. At the Crowne Plaza, they still have the older furniture and TV's along with peeling wallpaper. They have a similar type room layout, although I believe the 2 room suites at the Crowne Plaza are larger. The Crowne Plaza has an atrium like Embassy Suites. The only thing missing is a manager's reception and a free breakfast. The main reason I have started staying at the Crowne Plaza is the price. With Priceline's name your own price, I can stay at the Crowne Plaza for about 1/2 the price of the nearby Embassy Suites. The lesser price overcomes the no free breakfast or drinks in the evening. Overall, the property is nice and a great value. If you are looking for a good deal, it would be hard to beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business”
Reviews.Author: Nir T
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times and it is always of the same quality. The rooms are spacious with full amenities. The beds are comfortable and WiFi is free. The breakfast has buffet, fruit, yogurt and fruits. Staff was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: bonniebarnes
Reviews.Content: We wanted a nice, quiet weekend get away and the Crowne Plaza Suites provided one of the nicest stays we've had in a hotel in a long time! The room was spacious, staff helpful, and the surrounding area had plenty of nice restaurants and shopping. We got more than we expected... a refreshing change of pace for us!

Reviews.Title: “If you stay here, make sure you bring a car”
Reviews.Author: BizDev
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crown Plaza for a two week period in February taking part in a training program. I've divided my review into several parts in order to organize it a little. ROOM: As the name says, this is a suite hotel. The suites are among the nicer mid-price hotels at which I have stayed and are quite large. All face an inner courtyard that goes up multiple floors (a la many Hyatt hotels). There are bridges that connect walkways from each floor to the elevators at the core. If you have problems with height, therefore, it would be best to ask for a lower level suite. The railings are ironwork and it's a looonnnng way down from the upper floors. The suites consist of a living room in the front with a very nice kitchen area and a good work space (good light; lots of outlets). The WiFi functioned superbly. There is a nice sofa, a chair with a hassock, and a fairly decent television that got good reception in both the living area and the bedroom. The kitchen consists of a small refrigerator and a microwave. There were very limited kitchen tools, cutlery, and so forth. There is a small coffee pot with ceramic mugs, which are so much nicer than the plastic cups Holiday Inn makes available. The pot supports what seemed to me to be average sized mugs (brought from home) for coffee; however' the cups provided (which were smaller) are the same as those used in the restaurant. The bedroom is separated from the living area by the bath and therefore is away from hall noise (for example the screams of guests falling over the railings...just kidding). The bedrooms have windows opening to the exterior. Since the hotel is plopped in the midst of vast concrete network of parking lots and strip malls there isn't much of a view. The bath was very nice and there was plenty of hot water and large, fluffy towels. The closets were more than adequate for a single traveler. I had a friend visit me over the weekend and there was plenty of room for her clothes as well. FRONT DESK AND FACILITIES The hotel has laundry facilities on two floors that consist of one washer and one dryer. They seemed to work very well (I used them). Front desk staff were very welcoming and helpful, including helping me to mail letters, which is not always the case. The concierge was dismissive of inquires before my arrival (it WAS, as she archly informed me when I called, Superbowl weekend after all). In person she was quite pleasant and I believe helpful. One of her activities was gathering, when informed by guests checking out, left over foods from the refridgerator for distribution to the homeless. There is a very nice gift shop staffed by helpful and friendly people on the ground floor. The lobby is quite nice with lots of comfortable seating and the Hotel offers a good bar with a decent selection of wines by the glass (or I suppose by the bottle). The bar is an open lobby bar and was a good place to sit during the day outside of class for work, email checking, and so forth. The hotel "boasts" a fitness center which is easily identified because there is a sign on the door. It is just off the lobby and has nice views of the pool. The equipment is acceptable but limited (two tread mills of reasonably recent vintage and some other aerobic type gear), I did not use the pool, which is mostly outside. It appeared to be small, but probably great for a dip at the end of the day. BUSINESS CENTER There is a business center, right off the front desk, but it's small. As a result it was often in use. There was plenty of paper for the copier, the computers seemed to work well (I just used them to print boarding passes) and the Internet connection was reasonably fast. Help was not far away if it was needed. FOOD The restaurant is one of the two weak points for this facility. The menu is limited, the food tastes, well, like hotel food, and it's extremely expensive given what is provided. The management obviously is aware that there are literally no real restaurants in walking distance (more on what IS available later) and charge for the convenience. There is a buffet for breakfast and that can be a reasonable choice, although it is somewhat expensive. The coffee was good and the staff was willing to fill cups for those making their way to meetings. I ate dinner at the restaurant one night. That's how I know about the quality of the wine at the bar. Sometimes we drink to forget. CONFERENCE SERVICES (SO TO SPEAK) The second weak area for this facility was its conference support. The refreshments were put out late and pulled early and consisted only of sugary pastries and the like. There was seldom enough coffee and when it was gone...it was gone. The staff working in the conference area were abrupt and in some cases rude (not the waiters; what appeared to be the management). I was not managing this effort, but from what I could understand from the conference coordinators the hotel was minimally cooperative, especially to special needs. It is possible, however, that the quality of the food was directly related to the budget. I was not involved in that, do not know what the alternatives were, or if the offering was expensive relative to the offerings of other hotels. I can only say that I attended several meetings with this group in 2011 and assume their budgets were relatively similar. The food and service at the other two sites were significantly better. THE SURROUNDING AREA The only food within walking distance was a Subway, a Quiznos, a burger restaurant and (I am not kidding here) a CVS drug store. The area is bisected by 8 and up lane highways and is not pedestrian friendly. Even if you brave the traffic and walk, you are still a long way from anywhere. Restaurants are available a mile or two up Coit Road as well as in toward downtown Dallas on Coit (both 20 minute or so drives). Having a car here is essential. With a car -- and the Dallas freeways -- much more is possible. That is, given the traditional hazards of driving in Dallas: traffic jams that materialize out of no where and drug store cowboys with big pickup trucks and short tempers. All in all, however, I found very few decent (not great; decent) restaurants at all in this part of town. Downtown Dallas is a reasonable (if occassionally hair-raising) drive down the freeway and the Galleria (which is a fairly large, but very pedestrian shopping mall) is also only a couple of exits and a traffic tie up or two around the beltway. Downtown Dallas has several interesting art museums, closely located. Fort Worth, also within a reasonable drive has even better museums as well as the stockyard, which is worth a visit if for no other reason than to people watch. And, if you want to trace the history of drugstore cowboys with short tempers and bad driving skills, South Fork, the ranch where Dallas was 'set' is not far from the hotel. Like most of Dallas, it's been surrounded by a sea of suburbs. SUMMARY The rooms at this hotel and the staff make it a good value. I wouldn't hold a conference, eat here, or stay without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility with awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: blessed70508
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property which was immaculate and provided every possible amenity and convenience. The lobby had a 10 story ceiling which was stunning! It contained a gift shop, business center, lounge and restaurant. Free parking and free internet- amazing for this caliber of hotel. The pool was partly indoor and partly outdoor and included a whirlpool and fitness center beside it. Three elevators were located in the center of the lobby ensuring no one had to stand around waiting for a lift. The rooms are all suites and were clean and very well equipped- all the usual soaps, shampoo etc with the addition of an eye mask, ear plugs and linen water spray! A small refrigerator, sink, microwave and coffee pot made up the hospitality center in the sitting room which also contained a table and 2 chairs, a sofa and coffee table and a television. The bedroom had a very large mirrored closet, armoire with television and a comfy reading chair with an ottoman. The bed was comfortable and contained an assortment of pillows. The staff was exceptional and my husband and I were treated like royalty- they even let us check in at 8:30 am! Awesome hotel would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: 1brent
Reviews.Content: We rented a king suite and were very pleased. The hotel is a non smoking facility. The bed was comfortable. The room was quiet and clean. The hotel felt safe and secure. It had easy access to the interstate.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and staff”
Reviews.Author: 55711Knippen
Reviews.Content: We came from New York for a 2 week training here in Dallas, and we had a wonderful time while staying in the Crown Plaza. The hotel staff was very much accommodating, In fact, thats what we heared from other guests we met here. The cleanliness of the facility , pool , lobby and rooms, were very well maintained. we recommend this hotel to any one who appreiciates to stay in a GREAT PLACE with friendly service. The Ferencz Family

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel for your family”
Reviews.Author: quigley25
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed one night for a next day medical appointment. I travel frequently and knew right away this room wasn't clean. At first glance the lobby looks great, but then you get into the rooms and it is a polar opposite. - Damp musty smell in the rooms - Almost like a chlorine type smell that burned our noses and eyes - Hairs (multiple) in the sheets along with many stains. - Floor was dirty in room and bathroom. Very low bathroom ceiling. - 1980's televisions and furniture Next door to the south of the hotel is a slummy hotel/apartment which scared the bed bugs out of us. This hotel is not located in the best neighborhood. Police were in the lobby when I went down to get additional luggage. They were trying to find someone for something. Very uncomfortable. Customer service seemed to be average. I did complain to the front desk while checking out. Would have left altogether had it been only me, but moving the whole family just didn't seem viable late at night. Today I check my account and they billed me for $20.00 that was not on the final bill. I called them and they said it was for incidentals and would be refunded Monday. Today is Thursday, so I am not clear as to why it takes five days to remove it. I have never had a hotel place a charge like this. Don't waste your time as you will be disappointed. I'm sure the manager will be on here shortly to counter my negative feedback with many posts. I will never stay in a Crowne Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place but probably would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: TheMayfs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of a repair and some upgrades. TV in room was something out of the 80's w/ very poor picture quality. Bathroom ceilings are very low, cabinets chipped and cracked as well as bathroom tile surround. Room furniture was in disrepair. While the power went out to entire hotel (okay this happens) BUT when turned back on the hotel's phone system was out for entire weekend. Workout room equipment was TWO pieces and that was it !!!!!! Service at hotel bar on Friday and Saturday night was ridiculous. Friday at 10 p.m. came into bar for a cocktail and the lone waitress told us she was getting off and we had to order from the bartender. Got the bartenders attention and she promptly told us of the number of orders in front of us. This comment was made within hearing distance of the waitress getting off but that did not seem to concern the waitress. Saturday was no better. You'd figure weekend staffing at a hotel bar would be more than one bartender. If I just need a place to sleep and that's it I maybe would stay here again BUT if I wanted anything else out of a hotel will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, decent hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: eyhchen
Reviews.Content: Rooms are huge with your own living room. The room was very clean. The bathroom was slightly outdated, but still ok for a hotel in the $89/night AAA rate range. Buffet breakfast in Cafe Biaritzz is pretty good; I think it's $15/pp if not included in your room rate.

Reviews.Title: “One of my first places in the US...”
Reviews.Author: Wellcraft19
Reviews.Content: This place looks almost the same as it did in 1993, but that is not to say it is bad. Rooms are very spacious, decently equipped, and the place is quiet, even though close to LBJ freeway. Parking outside can be a tad tight, and the neighborhood is borderline seedy in some areas. This is a big hotel, nicely priced, in a central north location, and it is a place where you can actually "pull back" and get soem work done when locked down in your room. Spacious office desk and handy outlets. WiFi seem to be working fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: CJ611
Reviews.Content: I booked this stay on Priceline and was able to get it for $45 a night! So for the price it was great! We arrived in on an early flight and was able to check in at 8 am. Our room was a little outdated. The carpet and furniture are ugly and dated but were in good condition. The TVs are older models but worked, so can't really complain. The beds are ok. There were holes in the sheets and probably ready to be thrown away. The food in the restaurant is very pricey but delicious. I personally wasn't fond of the chicken tortilla soup, but they removed it from my ticket without even asking. The lobby is nicely updated and the place is very clean. We didn't use the pool or gym but both were clean and the equipment in the gym appeared newer and in good condition. The service we recieved from Karen at the concierge desk was excellent. She went above and beyond her job! We were in Dallas for a medical procedure and she called me the day of surgery and asked how I was and if there was anything we needed, and we had checked out. The afternoon concierge was ok but he didn't know where the hospital was and not near as friendly as Karen. She takes her job seriously and makes you feel like family. I was able to look past the outdated rooms because of the wonderful service she provided! The place is very clean and a bargin when booked on priceline. When visiting the DWF area, we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: OTR22
Reviews.Content: I attended a two day meeting at this hotel and found it to be great. My guestroom was very comfortable, great wireless internet speed, and the bed was more comfortable than my own. The staff was professional and friendly, and really seemed to care about the guests of the hotel. All elements of the meeting were perfect. Food, audio visual equipment, service, etc were all done well. Our group also enjoyed the restaurant and bar. The fitness room was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great meetings hotel”
Reviews.Author: BethBoyd
Reviews.Content: The service at this Crowne was superb in all departments! The food and presentation of food was excellent. I was very impressed. Great workout equipment. very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Agraontour
Reviews.Content: I stayed five days for a meeting. The hotel architecture is very interesting, the staff is gentle and well trained, suite was comfortable and well equiped with two TV sets, sofas, small kitchen with coffe maker, microwave and refrigerator, etc. Bedroom was large with a king bed comfortable and plenty of pillows. The whole hotel looked clean and in mint condition. A big CVS, a Starbucks and a Macdonalds are located at short walking distance, and several shopping centers at not more than 10 minutes driving. I shall stay again at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Booked on Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: SGmom
Reviews.Content: I followed the tip from a previous reviewer, & booked on Hotwire. $60 for a Friday night reservation. I was very pleased. The pool was great. The hotel was beautiful. And the food was FABULOUS!!!

Reviews.Title: “It felt like home, very comfortable and cozy.”
Reviews.Author: pezwitch
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, the lobby is very welcoming with a fountain and soaring atrium. The rooms were spacious with a sitting room (with a sofa, television and rolling desk which doubled as a dining table), a small kitchenette with a bar sink, small refridgerator and a microwave), and a large bedroom. I found the decor homey and cozy. The windows that overlook the atruim were a nice touch, I felt like I was coming home each time I returned to the room and saw the warm light shining through the windows. My husband calls this hotel "A Very Comfortable Place To Be Sick". He felt ill the first night. The staff was wonderful. were very accomidating to our needs, they were able to point me to CVS pharmacy within walking distance and extra bathroom neccessities and towels were brought very quickly. The room service choices were nice, I was able to get him a fresh fruit plate and some chicken and rice soup. I went on to the conference and the conference rooms were bright and clean. Our room was off the atrium and I was able to run up to the room between meetings. I was a bit worried about the noise from the conference reaching my husband (who was sleeping) but while I could hear sounds in the sitting area the bedroom was very quiet. My husband said the bed was very comfortable and he mentioned the duvet/comforter was very nice. We are definately going to be stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A steal on Hotwire.com”
Reviews.Author: PrincessaMyron
Reviews.Content: We were attending a wedding at the Doubletree Campbell Center on Sunday and wanted to stay somewhere nearby, so we searched Hotwire and selected the '3 1/2 star hotel' that turned out to be this one! The rate was $55 for one night, plus tax, versus $125 or so on the hotel website. My husband and I work overnight and called the hotel around 830am on Sunday, to see what the earliest check-in time would be. We spoke with Kerri (sp?) who said they had plenty of rooms available now, so we headed in that direction. VERY easy to find, and we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Beautiful lobby, very open and classy. There's a small bar and restaurant, neither of which we visited. Check in was easy and our suite was right by the elevator, but we had no transient noise. The suite consists of a living room with a 'tube' TV, sleeper sofa, chair, work-desk and a small fridge, 1-cup coffee maker and microwave. There's a separate door to the bathroom/bedroom area. The king-sized bed was comfortable, with plenty of pillows, but they're the small ones, not the king-sized ones, so I always find that odd! Not a fantastic sleep on the bed, but average. The room was very clean, and even though we had a smoking room, it didn't reek of stale smoke, thank goodness! Since our room was pre-paid via hotwire.com, we had no 'check-out' process, but I would guess that would be as easy as check-in. We requested a late check-out and were able to stay until 2pm Monday afternoon! Overall, good location, great price on Hotwire and a very nice property!

Reviews.Title: “Got the boot...”
Reviews.Author: Tracy P
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum rewards club member with this hotel's parent group. I booked, however, via Hotwire. When I did my initial search, I chose this hotel because it showed it as a "suite" property and since I'd be having a few clients over I thought this would be great to have the extra space and a little kitchen, etc. I found the hotel's direct number and called ahead, giving them my priority club/rewards club #. I also asked them for King suite. They said, "sorry we can't book rooms until you checkin". Ok fine. So I go to checkin and the guy tells me I got the last room in the hotel. Strange, the parking lot was only about 1/2 full at best. ?? Then I get to my room and its a dinky, crammed in the back corner room with no views of the lovely atrium and NO suite, sitting area, kitchen, etc. I call the front desk. Nope, that was the last room. Ok. fine. But I don't think so but I'm tired and I just want to go to bed. I cancelled my plans to meet up with my clients for a drink since the room is so tiny and the bar downstairs was packed with what seemed to be a big group of noisy convention goers. The room was very clean, the bed very comfy. When I expressed my level of dissatisfaction to the clerk he said there was no manager on duty so nothing really he could do to help me until in the morning. Too late then, I think and I go to bed. I enjoy the Crowne Plaza Market Center but not this North Dallas location. It's out of the way and the rooms are misleading. It even says "Crowne Plaza Suites" on the big sign on the side of the 10 story hotel that you can see from LBJ freeway. It should say, 'Suites and a few tiny rooms for Hotwire customers" Forgot to add the lamp didn't work on the desk and the only plug in for my laptop was behind the big desk so you either had to crawl under or pull out the desk. There were no condiments to go with my coffee maker. I had black coffee but usually take cream/sugar. It was too late to bother the guy at the front desk when I discovered this. He hadn't, after all, been very helpful thus far.

Reviews.Title: “Always Good”
Reviews.Author: fwtxtravel
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel 5-6 times a year. We love in the Fort Worth area, but stay here on weekends of soccer events. I have never had a bad experience. Rooms are always clean, rates are usually fantasic. A great hotel for family, business, or a one night stop during travel.

Reviews.Title: “Damp, dirty, old and in the ghetto.”
Reviews.Author: TexasJ30
Reviews.Content: I am not one to complain about hotel stays but I think this time is a must. My wife and I stayed here after reading the trip advisor reviews. I called the hotel before booking and asked about their most recent renovations, they told me they had a renovation 2008. This hotel looks like it hasn't been renovated since 1985. The hotel looks like a hotel from an 80's film. The rooms are old and dirty, and badly need renovating. The worst part of the hotel is that the rooms are DAMP. REALLY DAMP. Everything is damp in the rooms and it feels nasty and there is a funky smell in the air. (Both the first room and the second room I moved into were the same...nasty and damp) Besides the place being disgusting and old and very outdated, the hotel next door is ghetto. There is a rod iron gate around the entire hotel, which divide this hotel property from all that hangout in the parking lot next door till the wee hours of the night doing who knows what. My wife asked for clean towels to be brought up and they had some brown stuff on them... I won't take the time to discuss. (You get the point) The staff did their best to be courteous but they are second rate. The elevators are slow and temperamental. This hotel is just GROSS. It should seriously be condemned. Stay at a Hampton Inn or a Marriott near Beltline. If you like the location I recommend you stay down the street at the Best Western Dallas Hotel and Conference Center, much cleaner, safer, and a better value. Anything is better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: elana25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right off of 635 on the north part of the 635 loop. The hotel has suites which include a living area with large desk, TV, Sofa, bar area with refrigerator, microwave and small coffee maker. The suites are located around the perimeter of a large atrium. I found the hotel to be very quiet. The beds are very comfortable. The bath is arranged with all bathroom facilities in one room (vanity, toilet and bathtub together). Bedroom had a large flat screen TV. The breakfast buffet is very generous with made-to-order eggs or omelets - large selection of breads and cereals, fruit, yogurt . The AAA rate is excellent. Very convenient location to shopping and to Medical City Hospital and doctor's offices if going to Dallas for medical reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lurch1
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Was very very clean, very beautiful inside. Spacious suites. Would definitely stay here also as a business traveler given the 2 room suite with large desk, free wifi, microwave and fridge. A tv in both bedroom and main room. Main lobby was huge with plenty of area and privacy for small meetings and get togethers. Convenient location off the 75 and LBJ freeways. A CVS and a McDonalds walking distance. Better food options a couple exits north on the 75. Staff was greatly helpful!

Reviews.Title: “WOW What a GEM!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kaycoll
Reviews.Content: Stayed two days at the Crowne Plaza Suites in Dallas Texas for a meeting. What a hotel! Everything was perfect. The room was so comfortable and quiet. The staff exceptional. Special mention to Karen the Concierge who saw to my every need. The food presentations fabuluous and the entire meeting a success. Would recommend this to anyone visiting for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Soup to Nuts, an outstanding experience!”
Reviews.Author: AKS3
Reviews.Content: Under one minute check in with all smiles and used my name. Pointed to my room number rather than announcing it. Room was clean, bed extra comfy, staff anticipated needs and immediately responded to requests. Great breakfast with freshly cooked omelets (and more of course). Very green hotel, beautiful atrium, and a nice gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “Niceee Stay”
Reviews.Author: KBK2500
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Property each time I come to Dallas on Business. I love the hotel and the atmoshpere of the friendly staff. The rooms are always well clean and I enjoy the spaciousness of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast buffet is great”
Reviews.Author: Ryutaro
Reviews.Content: For the business trip, this is for my best hotel with great gym facility and breakfast buffet. The barman was nice too ^^;

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms - okay price/value”
Reviews.Author: Ranger215
Reviews.Content: This hotel scores with suites - every room has a separate living and sleeping room; efficient check-in service. Rooms are quite dark and do become old, bed is good though. Outside pool and hot tub. Location not amazing. Breakfast buffet okay, as well as price/value

Reviews.Title: “Roomy hotel close to Galleria”
Reviews.Author: thewizard16
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a total of 5 nights at this point in more than one room. This is an all-suite open atrium hotel, which is quite nice but feels a little dated. That's not to say that it's old or run down, it's not, it is just the general design of the hotel and furniture that feel much less contemporary than some of its competitors, including the Embassy Suites just down the road from it. The rooms are quite large- two full rooms, a living room with large desk, TV, sofa, and such and a bedroom with one or two beds, a TV, corner arm chair, etc. The furniture is all pretty nice and high quality, just not new. Nothing is particularly worn, however, and it appears they try to keep the rooms updated. The TVs are old and need to be swapped out for some flat panels. The bathrooms are pretty standard, but with a few nice touches. There is a little kitchenette like area between the bedroom door and the main part of the living room with another sink, the coffee maker, mini-fridge, and microwave. The beds are very good- if you like a little plusher bed with high quality linens, sheets, and covers, the Crowne Plaza's bedding collection is pretty much perfect. I like this hotel overall and it's a great deal for the amount of space you get and the comfort level of the beds, but I had a few gripes the most recent time I stayed. First, the room was not cleaned properly- I found food in the mini-fridge and there was something (food substance) sticky on the counter top above the fridge. There was a candy wrapper just laying out in the floor in the bedroom as well. Also, the prices at the bar and restaurant are a bit inflated for the quality you get. The food is pretty good, but not close to worth the price (of course, that is true of most restaurants in hotels like this). The desk staff here is pretty flat too- they were all professional, but seemed pretty unmotivated and didn't really stand out in anyway. I do like the information touchscreen by the concierge desk, it allows you to pick categories of services, attractions, and other points of interest and shows you where they are from the hotel. Overall, a very good deal for a roomy hotel room with a great bed, but apparently spotty housekeeper ability and nothing special in the line of services or amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed...”
Reviews.Author: ladyvirtue37
Reviews.Content: I have never slept so well in my life! I wanted to take the bed with me. Really. Hotel was in a great location two exits up from the $4.99 shoe store. Can't beat that right?

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent service for families”
Reviews.Author: thinkerbell
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband, toddler and infant at the Crowne Plaza in Dallas for 3 nights and was very impressed. It was very convenient to feed my always-hungry 3 year old with the microwave, sink and refrigerator in the room. The suite gave us some extra room and my toddler got a kick out of sleeping on the fold out couch. Although the decor was dated, the rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. The staff was very accomodating and responded to all of our requests promptly. The free internet access and parking was a nice change from the usual $10/day fee at other hotels. I would definitely stay agan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - all suites”
Reviews.Author: Zany_C
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this hotel, and it was a great value for the Priceline price I was able to get. We were a little nervous upon arrival because of the imposing wrought-iron fence around the parking lot, but we were able to find parking right next to the front door. Our car was fine the next morning. The bed was comfortable, but not luxurious, and there were no batteries in one of the remotes. We ended up just using one remote for both televisions since it worked. The kitchenette counters and refrigerator were clean. The carpet around the sink area was very sticky. Loved having the mini-living room with the door that closed onto the bedroom. I would have appreciated better water pressure in the shower. Even though it had an ajdustable nozzle, I never could get very much water to shower in. The indoor/outdoor "heated" pool was FREEZING!! My husband was able to get in, but I settled for the spacious and hot spa. The pool and spa area were very clean and well maintained. I was disappointed that a complimentary breakfast was not offered. The front desk staff was very courteous and friendly. For dinner, the concierge recommended a beautiful Italian restaurant about three miles from the hotel and gave us a map with all the necessary information on it for area restaurants. I would recommend the room and hotel, but would not return due to there being no complimentary breakfast. (Would go to the hotel across the parking lot.)

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: aanettles
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights with the help of Hotwire for $39.00 a night, and this was for a suite. This was an awesome hotel and hopefully when we book again we will be able to get this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed infested with Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Lynnjoan
Reviews.Content: Situation handled poorly. Manager was surprised at seeing so many bugs. He gave a roll of quarters for 5 girls to clean clothes and moved them down the hall, 1 night stay free. Never a follow up. Customer service people rude, never a reply from headquarters. Dept. of Health in Dallas not interested. A major health issue and no one cared

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewHHH
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza Dallas is situated about 10 miles north of downtown Dallas, right off the I-635 freeway. It's a beautiful hotel, inside and out; I was given a roomy king suite even though I had gotten it on Priceline. (Maybe all the rooms are like this.) The hotel is kind of circular and all rooms face inside - and there are no long hallways to walk, etc. The hotel is certainly nowhere near downtown Dallas but is located somewhat close to a DART (light rail train) station, though not quite close enough to walk and I wouldn't try. Instead, I took the hotel shuttle (free) to and from the DART station, though on the day I went (mid-week) the free parking lot at the DART station had spaces open, so I could have just driven and parked. I took DART into downtown Dallas to do some site seeing (e.g. Dealey Plaza - get off at West End) and it worked very well. Actually, if you do use the hotel shuttle, make sure you ask ahead of time (like the night before) about your potential use of it, because it gets booked up sometimes. I was told that in the afternoon the shuttle was booked for a few hours during rush hour (about 4-6pm) collecting local people who were coming from working at job sites all day. I got the idea that you can't rely on just calling the shuttle and having it come get you immediately. Service at the hotel was excellent - everyone I talked to was friendly and helpful. In the room, the bed was very comfortable - I slept well. Free wireless internet at the hotel worked great. There were two TVs, one in each room, though they were the old-style "tube" type not flat screens or anything. I didn't eat at the hotel; there are fast food places and a Starbucks nearby but lots of restaurants within a few miles if you have a car. I used the spa one night - it's outside, by the half of the pool that is also outside. If there were bubbles I could not find the switch to turn them on - oh, well, still very relaxing. If there was one downside (?), it was that there were no nightlights in the room and none of the light switches were lighted, so if you need to get up in the middle of the night, the room is completely dark. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: flga747
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for an extended weekend and really enjoyed it. The hotel was resonable and comfortable. They took pets for a small fee which was great for us and we appricated. The staff was very nice and helpfull and I talked to the manager several times in passing who helped us out as well. They gave us great ideas and directions to sites around Dallas. The lobby was very nice and we loved the atrium. The room had a seperate bedroom and living room and was very nice and comfortable. We stayed on the executive floor although nothing extra came with this as near as I could tell. The only down sides were breakfast and the pool. The pool was not very kept up and the inside part smal, it really needs to be updated. The outside was full of leaves and not well kept. the help at breakfast was not very attentive and it took me several days to relize that they cooked omlets as the chef perhaps did not want to have to work too hard, not sure. Had to ask for coffee refills and the help here was just not as nice as the rest of the hotel. Also, got billed for breakfast one day although it came with the room, they do need a better system for that. Room service was good but expensive but you pay for the conveience so I can't complain. Overall a great stay in Dallas and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Originalsweetone
Reviews.Content: This was a great value with my priceline bid. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. I did not eat any meals, so I cannot comment about the restaurants. The front desk was efficient and friendly. The wireless internet access worked flawlessly. I will happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but car needed”
Reviews.Author: RandomPilot
Reviews.Content: This all-suite hotel is very well maintained and run by friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are large and well equipped with microwave, fridge, two TVs, free internet and a nice (if somewhat small) pool. Unusually the pool is both indoor and outdoor, allowing you to swim through the wall, and there is a hot-tub/spa to relax in afterwards. The hotel food is OK, but quite pricey and there are lots of restaurants around which offer better value or higher quality. However, there is very little within walking distance - a small grocery store and a Starbucks - so a car is essential. Actually getting to the hotel is a bit tricky, especially if coming from the west side of town (e.g. DFW airport). Once you know where the turning is, it's easy, but a SatNav is recommended for the first time, or a REALLY good study of the map first.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: gateandpath
Reviews.Content: We almost did not stay here because of some of the reviews, but a lady that lives in Dallas assured us it was a nice place so we took a chance. I'm so glad we did!! The staff was wonderful. They were curtious and went out of their way to make sure we were happy. Everyone was very responsive to every request. I can't have any gluten and the staff at the restaurant actually went and got packages to read to see if there was any ingredients that would bother me. The front desk people were always very pleasant. The room was very nice. It looked like new carpeting. The bathroom could have been re-done, but the rest of it was perfect! It was a bit noisy at night from the restaurant and bar, but in the bedroom I heard nothing. It was very quiet by the time 11:00 rolled around. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend it. PS it is not located in the hot spot of Dallas, so the surroundings outside are not posh.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: sportparent
Reviews.Content: Booked a soccer team with the hotel my contacts name was Lavonna. From the start things did not go right. Never returned my calles or emails. My soccer team did not get the room types we asked for. She told me to call her boss who did nothing and was rude. Rooms were old and smelled. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: WI_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October of 2007, and had a decidedly mixed experience. First the good: the hotel inside is beautiful with a large atrium and very nice bar and restaurant area. The staff was extremely courteous, even sending someone up to my room when I did not answer the phone for my wake up call. The rooms were all great, with a large sitting room, great bathroom, and very comfortable beds. There were several negatives, however. We took the DART train to a hockey game downtown, and called and requested the complimentary shuttle pick us up at the Forest Road stop at 10:20. We had to call again at 10:45, and the shuttle finally showed up at 11. Also, we were having drinks in the bar and were asked to not laugh so loud so as not to disturb guests. Seemed silly to ask bar patrons to laugh more quietly, but oh well.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be robbed stay here!”
Reviews.Author: vjhill2002
Reviews.Content: My son stayed in the hotel and from the minute he drove his vehicle in and parked in the front by the main door he had a bad feeling! His vehicle was broken into the next morning even though they had 2 full-time security guards present along with video cameras! It was an inside job! They have had several break-ins in the past few months! Mangement was unhelpful other than stating ...."We are not respoonsible"!

Reviews.Title: “A nice, clean hotel with courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: smudad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location three times this year. The rooms are clean and the staff has always been helpful. The service in the cafe downstairs has always been prompt and courteous, I have only eaten breakfast there. On my previous trips I stayed at the Marriott Market Center Suites; I looked at the rooms at the Sheraton Suites, Marriott Fairfield and the Radisson, and feel that while these hotels are okay; the Crowne Plaza does offer a separate living room from the bedroom with privacy, some of these others did not offer privacy or a suite configuration in the event you travel with children. Another thing that was a plus was that the wireless internet was provided at no cost; the others charged for it. Also, the Sheraton Suites charged a parking fee to park in the parking lot. The hotel also offers a breakfast buffet package for an additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. The rooms were a nice size, great beds, quite comfortable! Not much of a view outside (unless you like to watch traffic!) The indoor pool was clean but smaller. Room service was fine; good food. The breakfast buffet was pretty tatsy. Really can't complain about the place at all. The staff were friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Was good but could have been a lot better”
Reviews.Author: RFD
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights at the Crowne Plaza Suites. First time we've stayed there but have stayed at the Westin across the street, and Hilton Suites, Hilton Lincoln Center, Westin, Marriott, Renaissance, and Intercontinental in the Galleria area. The room is a two room suite with a small refrigerator, microwave, and two TV's. Carpet looks like astroturf. There is a door separating the bedroom from the lviing room. The Hilton suites, which is a 4 star, is much nicer and newer. We had a problem the first day with the toilet, and they failed to make up our room the first day, and one of the lights by the bed was burned out. They gave us a breakfast voucher for two to make up for it. This hotel is old and service is pretty poor, but the room was large, nice bed, and there is free wireless internet (same at the Hilton suites but internet is not free at the other places mentioned above, I think). Also, there is plenty of free parking. The breafast buffet is about $15 per person and is not worth half that. It is a bare bones full breakfast (scrambled eggs, bacon, some fruit and sweet rolls). We would stay there again for the $38 a night deal that we got on Priceline, but would pay more to get the Hilton suites. One good thing is that the CP is the only 3 star in this area on Priceline, so if you're looking for a suite, you know you'll get one if you win the bid.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal”
Reviews.Author: mot29
Reviews.Content: I booked this for a quick trip to Dallas to see my parents who evacuated from Hurricane Katrina to a friend's house in Dallas. Booked direct on the Crowne Plaza web site using the entertainment card and got a suite for $49.50 for a Saturday night. Room is really two separate rooms -- bedroom with queen bed, living room with double sofa bed, a really comfortable easy chair, work desk and refrigerator and microwave. Clean and comfortable, CP makes a deal of their beds -- comfortable, but I not up to Westin standards (but what do I expect for the price). I'm elite with Choice Privileges so was placed on the elite floor. Full Sunday Dallas newspaper at the door and a coupon for the continental breakfast at the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “TRUE EXPERIENCE FROM A TRAVEL PROFESSIONAL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Tried to switch to this North Dallas property after being disappointed about the other " Near the Galleria " Crown Plaza. The room looks cleaner ( although much smaller )than the other property, but the front desk services were also horrible. We reserve the rate and choose the room the night before, they give you a different one ( lower category ) for the same rate when you check in. Again, you must line up for any request or complain, with the other, as they short of staff, and management did not care since they already used to hear complaints. In fact, we have stayed in many hotels in the U.S. and around the world, and never seen so much unhappy guests. In fact, a tour bus driver bursted in outraged, since the whole bus were waiting, and no one was available to coordinate the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha on Alpha Rd!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice all-suite hotel. We were here from Europe and were pleasantly surprised with our first TX hotel. Room had a living room, bedroom and bathroom, all kept clean and in a good condition. You need a car to get anywhere from the location. It's nice quiet neighborhood and it swiftly connects to downtown Dallas and the highways. North Dallas is also easily accessible from here. We were late due to an 30 hour journey from Northern Europe (3 flights with delays) and came to the hotel at 2AM. We were welcomed nicely and there was no hassle at all. There is a picturesque lobby with elevators in the middle. Service was good all the way. Continental Breakfast was maybe a little overpriced, but still very good. We didn't try buffet breakfast. Would stay again, one of the most memorable Crowne Plazas I have been.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza was a very nice hotel. The rooms look exactly like the Embassy Suites design. When you first walk in, there is a living room with tv, table, couch, chair, phone. The middle part has a bathroom and basic kitchen (microwave, refrigerator, and sink). The back part is the bedroom with tv and phone. It was very clean. We did not try the restaurants during our stay. They have an indoor-outdoor pool & hot tub that are nice. Our room faced I-635 but the traffic noise was not bad at all. You could occassionally hear some traffic noise but it was not disturbing. The only negative I have is that the only restaurants close by were fast food. To go to a nice restaurant you had to drive a while. But overall the hotel was very nice. It was very quiet during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza Suites in Dallas (Alpha road) is an excellent hotel. This hotel has true "suites," with a seperate living room and bedroom. The living room has a couch, chair with ottoman, desk/chair, TV, and small kitchenette with a microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, sink, and cabinets. Next, is the bathroom and hallway closet, then the bedroom, with another TV. I loved the fact that there was a solid door between the living and sleeping areas--it was so easy to go to bed and not be disturbed by the TV in the other room. The suite was clean we arrived and housekeeping did a fabulous job everyday. The hotel is easy to get to off of I-635 and it's easy to find restaurants, malls, etc. in the area. I highly recommend this hotel. I found it through hotwire and was extremely pleased with my rate of $45.00/night.

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Suites Dallas - Park Central
HotelInfo.Address: 7800 Alpha Road, Dallas, TX 75240
